1. Play by the Rules
2. Take turns and share
3. Be open-minded
4. Listen to perspectives other than your own
5. Don‚Äôt take advantage of others
6. Don‚Äôt blame others carelessly
7. Treat all people fairly

Please review this definition of being a good citizen with your child at home.

Thank you,

Shannon Deen

Take turns and share
Be open-minded

Don‚Äôt blame others carelessly
Treat all people fairly

Please review the definition of Fairness with your child and discuss ways you as a family show fairness.

Thank you!
Shannon Deen

Things you could do at home to extend this learning are:
1. Show your child examples of people being good citizens.

3. Every time you go somewhere, make it a family plan to leave it better than you found it.

Thank you for all you do!

Shannon Deen

Here is the definition of citizenship to review with your child:

Citizenship - Do your share to make your school and community better
Cooperate
Get involved in community affairs
Stay informed/vote
Be a good neighbor
Obey laws and rules
Respect authority
Protect the environment
volunteer

Have a great weekend!
Shannon Deen
BISD Counselor

Wow, I can‚Äôt believe that we are already starting the 3rd 6 weeks of school. This year is flying!!! We will be on the look-out and recognizing students who represent the trait of caring. Please review the definition of caring with your child.
Caring- Be kind
Be compassionate (show you care)
Express Gratitude
Forgive Others
Help People in Need

Also, take time to discuss ways you and others are caring and recognize your child when you see him/her caring for others.

Other things to do with your child:
Ask what would it be like if people did not care for each other?
Have your child tell you ways they can show they care for others.

Thank you for all of your support!
Shannon Deen
North Elementary Counselor

Dear Parents,
We have continued our discussions and learning of the character trait respect. We have talked about how to treat others with respect and how to treat ourselves with respect. We have discussed that one way of showing respect is by using good manners.
At home, please:
1. Have your child practice good manners.
2. Role play scenarios and have your child try to use the appropriate manners for the situation. Ex: What to say when you meet someone new? What are good manners at the dinner table? How do you ask for help?
3. Discuss why good manners are important in the home, in the workplace, and at other events you attend.
Review what respect means with your child:
1. Treat other with respect - Follow the Golden Rule (treat others the way you want to be treated)
2. Be tolerant and accepting of differences
3. Use good manners
4. Don‚Äôt use bad language
5. Never threaten, hit or hurt anyone
6. Be considerate of the feelings of others
7. Deal peacefully with anger, insults, and disagreements

Thank you!
Shannon Deen
BISD Counselor
